# Copilot Instructions - git-for-devops

## Project Overview
This is a minimal Git learning repository for DevOps practices. The project demonstrates basic Git workflow with a simple static HTML file.

**Remote Repository**: `https://github.com/Shiv745/myrepo.git`

## Codebase Structure
- `index.html` - Simple HTML file serving as the main content of the repository
- `.git/` - Git version control directory (standard Git metadata)

## Key Patterns & Conventions

### HTML Files
- Single page application using standard HTML5 structure
- Uses minimal metadata and semantic HTML
- Responsive viewport meta tag included for mobile compatibility

## Development Workflows

### Git Operations
- Remote is configured as "origin" pointing to the GitHub repository
- Standard GitHub flow expected for contributions

## Common Tasks

### When Adding New Content
1. Add files to the root directory
2. Commit with descriptive messages
3. Push to origin/main branch

### Project-Specific Notes
- This is a learning repository, so experimental commits and branch workflows are expected
- Keep changes focused and well-documented in commit messages
- Preserve the `.git` directory configuration

## Important Files to Reference
- [index.html](index.html) - Entry point and current content
